snippet: Russia’s president acknowledged that country is “going through a trying period, difficult times at the moment,” but said it was not a crisis.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin holds three-hour news conference dismissing fears about country's financial turmoil; episode gives him opportunity to make his first public remarks since ruble exchange rate began swinging wildly; suggests revived global demand for oil will eventually solve problems.

byline.contributor: Andrew Roth contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Russia’s president acknowledged that country is “going through a trying period, difficult times at the moment,” but said it was not a crisis.

headline.seo: Vladimir Putin’s Annual Year-End News Conference
headline.main: Putin, Acknowledging Financial Turmoil, Assures the Nation It’s Temporary
headline.print_headline: Putin, Acknowledging Financial Turmoil, Assures the Nation It’s Temporary
